publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3621 George Foulkes: Culture Minister Must Apologise—That the Parliament calls on the Minister for Culture, External Affairs and the Constitution to retract his derogatory remarks about parts of Glasgow, Aberdeen, Edinburgh, Stirling and Lanarkshire, made in his book, In Waiting: Travels in the Shadow of Edwin Muir, of October 1998; in particular calls on the minister to retract the comments that imply that Glasgow is too dangerous to get out of a car and that tenement closes are covered with the bodies of unconscious drug addicts, that describe the flag on Edinburgh Castle as "an awful mutant tablecloth", that suggest that Dumfries is full of "skinny, ill-dressed women", that Aberdeen is inhospitable and that Stirling is undesirable, and believes that it is against the interests of Scotland to have a minister who is responsible for promoting Scotland and its culture to be seen to continue to hold these views. Supported by: Margaret Curran*, Helen Eadie*, Andy Kerr*, Michael McMahon*, Cathie Craigie*
